vocabularyItems.english: I went to Paris last summer for my vacation.
She came to visit me three days ago yesterday.
We saw an amazing movie at the cinema last weekend.
I knew the answer but forgot to write it down.
I thought about calling you but decided to wait instead.
He brought flowers for his mother on her birthday yesterday.
My grandmother taught me how to cook traditional Indian food.
The police caught the thief after a long chase yesterday.
I bought this dress at the sale last month.
The soldiers fought bravely during the war many years ago.
She sought advice from her teacher about her career path.
I found my lost keys under the sofa this morning.
She became a doctor after studying for seven long years.
The concert began at eight o'clock sharp last night.
He ran five kilometers every morning during his youth period.
The choir sang beautifully at the church wedding ceremony yesterday.
The phone rang three times before I finally answered it.
We swam in the ocean every day during our vacation.
I drank too much coffee yesterday and couldn't sleep well.
The ship sank during the terrible storm in nineteen twelve.
She spoke three different languages fluently when she was younger.
I accidentally broke my phone screen last week at work.
He chose medicine as his career after much careful thought.
My father drove us to school every single day.
She wrote a beautiful letter to her best friend yesterday.
I rode my bicycle to work every day last summer.
She wore a stunning red dress to the party.
He accidentally tore his shirt while playing football with friends.
The lake froze completely during the harsh winter last year.
Someone stole my wallet from my bag at the market.
The criminals fled the scene before police officers could arrive.
I slept for ten hours after the exhausting marathon race.
She wept tears of joy when she heard wonderful news.
The strong wind swept away everything in its destructive path.
The cat crept silently through the dark garden at night.
The athlete leapt over the high bar with amazing grace.
He dealt with the difficult situation very professionally and calmly.
I felt extremely nervous before giving my important presentation today.
She knelt down to tie her young daughter's shoelaces carefully.
He spelt his complicated name incorrectly on the official form.
I smelt something burning in the kitchen this morning early.
They dwelt in that old house for over thirty years.
I lent my favorite book to my colleague last week.
The strong wind bent the tall trees during the storm.
I sent an important email to my boss this morning.
We spent three wonderful weeks traveling across Europe last summer.
I meant to call you yesterday but completely forgot.
They built a beautiful new house in the countryside recently.
I accidentally spilt coffee all over my important documents today.
She burnt the dinner because she forgot about it.
I learnt many valuable lessons from my past mistakes fortunately.
I dreamt about flying over mountains last night while sleeping.
The children slid down the snowy hill with great excitement.
She hid the birthday present under her bed carefully.
He bid farewell to his friends before leaving forever.
My parents forbid me from staying out late at night.
I fed the hungry stray cats near my house.
The experienced guide led us through the dense jungle safely.
His wound bled heavily until the doctor treated it properly.
The snake shed its old skin during the transformation process.
The farmer bred horses on his large countryside ranch.
The ambulance sped through the crowded city streets urgently.
They wed in a beautiful ceremony surrounded by loving family.
Please shred all confidential documents before throwing them away.
We trod carefully through the muddy forest path yesterday afternoon.
The bright sun shone through my bedroom window this morning.
He swore to tell the complete truth in court.
She bore the pain bravely without complaining at all.
A serious problem arose during the important project meeting.
I woke up early to watch the beautiful sunrise.
The earthquake shook the entire building violently for minutes.
She took her children to the park every weekend.
I mistook him for his identical twin brother yesterday.
He forsook his comfortable life to help poor people.
We stood in the long queue for two hours.
I finally understood the complex mathematical concept after studying hard.
The old building withstood the powerful earthquake remarkably well yesterday.
She felt misunderstood by her family and close friends.
He withdrew money from the bank to pay bills.
The angry child threw his toys across the room.
The small plant grew into a beautiful tall tree.
The bird flew high above the mountains gracefully today.
The strong wind blew my hat off my head.
The talented artist drew a beautiful portrait of her.
The brave knight slew the fierce dragon in battle.
The rebels overthrew the corrupt government successfully last year completely.
She underwent major surgery at the hospital last month.
The experienced manager oversaw the entire construction project carefully daily.
Nobody foresaw the economic crisis that would happen soon.
He strode confidently into the important meeting room yesterday.
She wove a beautiful basket from natural materials skillfully.
The frightened child clung to her mother tightly during storm.
He flung the ball across the field with force.
The bee stung me on my arm this afternoon.
The children swung on the playground swings happily yesterday.
She wrung the wet towel to remove excess water.
I hung my coat on the hook near door.
The trap sprung shut when the animal approached it.
The national anthem was sung beautifully at the ceremony.
He slung his heavy backpack over his shoulder this morning.

liarGameData.explanation: A2 learners must master irregular past tense verbs which don't follow the regular -ed pattern. Common mistakes include using 'goed' instead of 'went', 'buyed' instead of 'bought', or 'teached' instead of 'taught'.
liarGameData.practice: went (not goed), saw (not seed), bought (not buyed), taught (not teached), caught (not catched)
liarGameData.tip: Irregular verbs must be memorized. There is no rule - practice makes perfect!
